item.title: Thanksgiving is an annual reminder of America’s refugee origins
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Want smart analysis of the most important news in your inbox every weekday along with other global reads, interesting ideas and opinions to know? Sign up for the Today's WorldView newsletter. Every culture has its harvest festival, but the distinctly North American tradition of Thanksgiving is wrapped up in myths of national origin. In both Canada and […]

item.title: That ‘harmless’ radioactive cloud over Europe probably did come from Russia after all
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: BERLIN — Remember that harmless radioactive cloud that mysteriously drifted across Europe back in September? Turns out it may indeed have come from Russia after all — from an area that had radioactivity of about 1,000 times higher than normal, as officials there acknowledged for the first time Tuesday. Experts emphasized that the unusually high levels may still have been harmless. […]

item.title: How Zimbabwe’s Mugabe clung to power for almost 40 years
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: Crowds poured into the streets of Zimbabwe on Tuesday, following Robert Mugabe's announcement that he would resign after almost four decades as the country's leader. In a move bearing all the hallmarks of a coup, Zimbabwe’s military had taken control of the country and Mugabe about one week ago. There had long been concerns about the health of the […]

item.title: Jubilation in Harare’s streets as Mugabe resigns
item.dc:creator: Max Bearak
item.description: Tuesday, Nov. 21, 2017. It is a date that has now entered the annals of history. Robert Gabriel Mugabe, Zimbabwe's president of 37 years, announced his resignation amid a military intervention and unprecedented street protests in the military's favor. He is 93 and was the oldest head of state in the world. His ouster comes after […]

item.title: Rapper Nelly is to perform in Saudi Arabia. Only men are allowed to attend.
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor
item.description: American rapper Nelly, famous for songs such as “Hot in Herre” and “Dilemma,” will visit Saudi Arabia next month for a concert in Jiddah with Algerian singer Cheb Khaled. The Dec. 14 concert will probably be a big event for a country where, until recently, public music performances were heavily restricted. However, the Saudi kingdom is in the midst […]

item.title: Angola shows early signs of meaningful democratic transition as Zimbabwe falters
item.dc:creator: Max Bearak
item.description: A revolutionary anti-colonial leader who held power for almost four decades. A government rife with nepotism and corruption. A people beset by poverty. Hope for a democratic transition, but far more skepticism that it would ever happen. No, this isn't Zimbabwe — it's Angola. Three months ago, southern Africa’s oil-rich bastion of economic inequality held open […]

item.title: Bollywood star drops event with Ivanka Trump amid death threats over film
item.dc:creator: Vidhi Doshi
item.description: A leading Bollywood actress has pulled out of a glitzy event in the Indian city of Hyderabad to be attended by Ivanka Trump and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi after a member of his governing party issued a $1.5 million bounty to behead the actress amid rumor-fueled outrage over a new film. Deepika Padukone's withdrawal is a blow to the […]

item.title: Yemen’s man-made catastrophe has no end in sight
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Want smart analysis of the most important news in your inbox every weekday along with other global reads, interesting ideas and opinions to know? Sign up for the Today's WorldView newsletter. In ancient times, the Romans referred to the land known as Yemen as “Arabia Felix,” or “Happy Arabia” — a country blessed with fertile, […]

item.title: Search for a missing submarine is stymied by new challenges: 20-foot waves and 50 mph winds
item.dc:creator: Cleve R. Wootson Jr.
item.description: An international team of searchers trying to locate a vanished Argentine submarine and its 44 crew members is being stymied by an uncooperative ocean while potential leads fell through. Twenty-foot waves and winds near 50 mph were battering more than a dozen search-and-rescue ships from the United States, Britain, Brazil and Chile traversing the area where the ARA […]

item.title: North Korea’s on-again-off-again status as a state sponsor of terrorism
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor
item.description: The U.S. government redesignated North Korea as a state sponsor of terrorism Monday. The move, announced by President Trump during a brief photo op at a Cabinet meeting, was designed to put pressure on Pyongyang's nuclear weapons program. “It should have happened a long time ago,” Trump told reporters. “It should have happened years ago.” […]
